interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Cartoon Network: Chowder: Volume 2
Review Date: 2012/12/24
Store: Nicky Jones  (Actor),     John DiMaggio  (Actor)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Kids & Family
Product Description: ['Product Description', 'Cartoon Network: Chowder: Volume 2', 'Marzipan City is a place where anything can happen and the unorthodox is commonplace. In the middle of this bizarre city is a quaint little shop known as Mung Daal Catering, which is owned by Mung Daal, one of the ost accomplished chefs and well known in the entire world. However, things have become a bit hectic in the kitchen as of late, as Mung Daal has recently acquired a young apprentice named Chowder, whom he wishes to pass along all of his knowledge towards. Chowder is an energetic young lad who wishes to become the greatest chef in the world, but his love of food and his extremely short attention span often results in him causing unintended havoc. However, theyre not alone. Truffles works at Mung Daal Catering and she takes the orders that her husband, Mung Daal, must prepare. Shnitzel, a rock monster, also helps out in the kitchen as he has worked for Mung Daal for years. Along the way, theyll meet the many colorful and zany residents of Marzipan City, though there will always be new dishes to prepare and exciting recipes to follow.', ']]>', 'Amazon.com', 'Five more episodes of', 'Chowder', 'await fans of the surreal and sublimely silly animated television series on this delicious second volume DVD. As with its predecessor, the episodes are not in broadcast order, which has no effect on their enjoyment; each of the 22-minute stories (broken into two 11-minute episodes) stands on its own in terms of zaniness and visual charm. Strongest among the batch included here is the Emmy- and Annie-nominated “Burple Nurples,” which circles around a somewhat morbid conceit: in an attempt to make the title dish, aspiring chef Chowder accidentally laces it with rat poison, sending his boss and mentor Mung Daal on a mad quest to track down all of his creations. Other episodes underscore the show’s gentle blend of kid-friendly storylines and out-and-out wackiness: “Mung on the Rocks” gives Chowder a chance to prove himself by bailing Mung out of a pickle with his wife, Truffles, while its companion piece, “Sniffleball,” finds our hero facing the classic conundrum: will he be the hero in a game of sniffleball or the goat? It’s this inherent sweetness, mixed with the lovely, off-kilter artwork and characterizations that make', 'Chowder', 'so appealing to viewers of all ages. Extras detailing the conception of this unique show would have been appreciated, but only a gallery of sketches and designs are present on this disc.', '--Paul Gaita']
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Kids & Family, Animation', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Widescreen, Subtitled, NTSC, Animated', 'Contributor': 'C.H. Greenblatt, Tara Strong, John DiMaggio, Dwight Schultz, Nicky Jones, Liliana Mumy, Dana Snyder', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Stereo), Unqualified', 'Number Of Discs': '1', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.78:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 0.53 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'DT90008D', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Widescreen, Subtitled, NTSC, Animated', 'Run time': '1 hour and 50 minutes', 'Release date': 'March 3, 2009', 'Actors': 'Nicky Jones, John DiMaggio, Liliana Mumy, Tara Strong, Dana Snyder', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Producers': 'C.H. Greenblatt', 'Studio': 'WarnerBrothers', 'Writers': 'C.H. Greenblatt', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: My step-son loves chowder and has had the volume 1 disc for a long time. I got this one for him for good grades and he loves it. He watches it all the time.
Review Title: For my step-son
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

['Product Description', 'Cartoon Network: Chowder: Volume 2', 'Marzipan City is a place where anything can happen and the unorthodox is commonplace. In the middle of this bizarre city is a quaint little shop known as Mung Daal Catering, which is owned by Mung Daal, one of the ost accomplished chefs and well known in the entire world. However, things have become a bit hectic in the kitchen as of late, as Mung Daal has recently acquired a young apprentice named Chowder, whom he wishes to pass along all of his knowledge towards. Chowder is an energetic young lad who wishes to become the greatest chef in the world, but his love of food and his extremely short attention span often results in him causing unintended havoc. However, theyre not alone. Truffles works at Mung Daal Catering and she takes the orders that her husband, Mung Daal, must prepare. Shnitzel, a rock monster, also helps out in the kitchen as he has worked for Mung Daal for years. Along the way, theyll meet the many colorful and zany residents of Marzipan City, though there will always be new dishes to prepare and exciting recipes to follow.', ']]>', 'Amazon.com', 'Five more episodes of', 'Chowder', 'await fans of the surreal and sublimely silly animated television series on this delicious second volume DVD. As with its predecessor, the episodes are not in broadcast order, which has no effect on their enjoyment; each of the 22-minute stories (broken into two 11-minute episodes) stands on its own in terms of zaniness and visual charm. Strongest among the batch included here is the Emmy- and Annie-nominated “Burple Nurples,” which circles around a somewhat morbid conceit: in an attempt to make the title dish, aspiring chef Chowder accidentally laces it with rat poison, sending his boss and mentor Mung Daal on a mad quest to track down all of his creations. Other episodes underscore the show’s gentle blend of kid-friendly storylines and out-and-out wackiness: “Mung on the Rocks” gives Chowder a chance to prove himself by bailing Mung out of a pickle with his wife, Truffles, while its companion piece, “Sniffleball,” finds our hero facing the classic conundrum: will he be the hero in a game of sniffleball or the goat? It’s this inherent sweetness, mixed with the lovely, off-kilter artwork and characterizations that make', 'Chowder', 'so appealing to viewers of all ages. Extras detailing the conception of this unique show would have been appreciated, but only a gallery of sketches and designs are present on this disc.', '--Paul Gaita']

**User Preferences Profile Summary:**

- **Interests:** The user shows a strong preference for animated content, specifically in the Kids & Family genre, indicating an affinity for family-friendly entertainment.
- **Context:** There is a notable emphasis on purchasing media for younger audiences, suggesting the user likely values content suitable for children, particularly for their step-son.
- **Content Style:** The user's interest in offbeat, whimsical narratives is evident, as indicated by their choice in purchasing a series recognized for its surreal and humorous storytelling.
- **Viewing Patterns:** The user appears to prioritize gifting media as a reward system for positive behavior, highlighting a thoughtful and engaging approach to nurturing interests in children.
- **Overall Sentiment:** The user exhibits a preference for high-quality, entertaining animations, as demonstrated by their positive review rating, indicating satisfaction with the content and its impact on their step-son's enjoyment.

This profile paints a picture of a user who prioritizes providing enjoyable, engaging, and quality animated content for children, specifically to foster enjoyment and learning through media.
